title: A Pink Sky Mystery in Birmingham
summary: In Birmingham, when it snowed one evening, people saw a pink glow in the sky. They wondered if it was a pretty sunset or the Northern Lights. But it was actually from LED lights on a football pitch at St Andrew's, where Birmingham City plays. The lights help the grass grow. The snow and clouds made the sky reflect the light, turning it pink. Other places like Hednesford also saw this because of their football lights. It was a fun surprise, not something magical.

background_read: This article is about a real event in Birmingham, England. When it snows, the sky can look different because of lights from places like football pitches. LED lights are used to keep grass healthy for sports. Sometimes, weather like snow and clouds can make the sky reflect these lights, creating colorful glows. It's a cool example of how science and everyday things can create surprising sights.
